/coingossip.content: Simplifying the tracking of news articles and social media discussions about cryptocurrencies.

content: During the cryptocurrency hype in 2018, there was a high volume of online discussions and speculations about cryptocurrencies across multiple social media platforms. However, as these discussions were extremely disorganised, many users (especially investors and market speculators) found it difficult to obtain insightful information regarding any specific cryptocurrency.
To tackle this issue, I set out to solve the following pain points:
Know what cyptocurrencies are currently trending in real-time
Have a list of news articles or disucsssion threads to provide context of trending cryptocurrencies
Determine the overall sentiment of the trending cryptocurrency, without having to read through the news or discussions manually
See the price actions in context of the trends and sentiment

Cryptocurrencies are listed in terms of their popularity on the internet ("Gossip"). For example, when evaluating a single Reddit post that is related to a cryptocurrency, CoinGossip will also include its title, its upvotes and its comments into consideration.
Data visualisation aids are used as well, including a pie chart and a scoreboard.

Users can quickly view all related headlines or discussions for any cryptocurrency. To reduce the need for manually reading every news item, a machine learning algorithm is applied to deduce the overall Sentiment of each news item. The sentiment can be seen from thumbs up (positive) and thumbs down (negative) icon.

As CoinGossip gained popularity, many users began submitting their feature suggestions. This led to the development of many user-requested features, with the most requested one being a historical trend analysis for custom cryptocurrencies.

/smartmirror.content: An easily deployable front-end dashboard that is compatible with most Smart Mirror installations.

content: In 2017, the popularity of the Raspberry Pi and IOT devices has led to an
A smart mirror is a two-way mirror with an electronic display behind the glass, which can show the viewer different kinds of information in the form of widgets.
My goal was to build a web based front end interface that can be easily used for smart mirror installations, and even standalone kiosk devices. Specfically, I wanted the UI to achieve the following:
View date and time information
Animated visuals of the current tempeature and weather
News ticker that provides the latest headlines
See the price actions of stocks and cryptocurrencies
This Smart Mirror UI is written completely using web technologies (HTML, Javascript) as a Single-Page-Application (SPA). It relies on other JSON APIs for its upstream information, such as:
Data.gov.sg for weather information
rss2json for news headlines
Yahoo Finance for stock prices
CoinMarketCap for cryptocurrency prices
As an SPA, it is easy to deploy to any lightweight IOT devices across many CPU architectures (arm, x86) and operating systems (Android, Linux distros, Windows IoT).
This project was completed in December 2017.

content: I personally discovered this game back in 2013 during my
However, while I loved the game, the need to bring the game cards was a constant irritation, as it limited my ability to play this game wtih friends in an impromptu fashion.
Hence, I set out to develop a digital alterative with the following requirements:
Completely eliminate the need for game cards to play the game
No compromises made to original game rules
Retain the physical feel of playing board games in person

My digial recreation of The Resistance was written as a Mobile Web App using jQuery Mobile. Instead of relying on game cards, playing the game now requires only a single mobile phone that is shared among the players during gameplay.
